intro: Alectorolophus drummond-hayi, commonly known as the Drummond's lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its crustose growth form, typically forming a thin, firm layer on rock surfaces. The thallus is usually pale yellow to orange in color, with a granular texture and distinct, irregular lobes. It is chemically distinct, containing usnic acid and other secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role. This lichen is often found in temperate and subarctic regions, thriving in shaded, moist environments.
